1.name: Sascha Wolter
1.title: Senior Developer Evangelist Connected Home
1.shortBio: UX enthusiast with passion for the IoT. Board member of the Usability & User Experience committee at the federal association BITKOM.
1.bio: Sascha Wolter is a professional developer and user experience enthusiast with passion for the Internet of Things in all flavors. He also works as a consultant, trainer, lecturer, keynote-speaker, and author who focusses on understanding, innovation and value. Sascha is the founder of the User Group flashforum.de with more than 100,000 members, and as such he is committed to the interests of the user. After organizing internationally renowned events like beyond tellerrand from 2001 to 2011, he is now board member of the Usability & User Experience committee at the federal association BITKOM. When he is not tinkering with new soft- and hardware for Deutsche Telekom AG – Connected Home, he likes discovering the world together with his kids in an odd way.

2.name: Davy Engone
2.title: Partner & Software Engineer
2.shortBio: Dreamer, Entrepreneur, Foodie, Runner, Basketball. Building @hackages.
2.bio: Dreamer, Entrepreneur, Foodie, Runner, Basketball. Building @hackages.

3.name: Joris Brauns
3.title: Coach and Consultant
3.shortBio: One-of-a-kind, ambitious and passionate coder always trying to learn and share.
3.bio:
Joris Brauns is a Coach and Consultant at Team4Talent. A Microsoft Most Valuable Professional,  Extended Experts Team Member at Microsoft. And a Co-Founder of the Open Windows Insiders Community Belgium.
One-of-a-kind, ambitious and passionate coder always trying to learn and share his development skills, challenge he faces head-on! But most of all, wanna have some fun while doing all of this.

4.name: Gill Cleeren
4.title: .NET Architect - Microsoft RD & MVP
4.bio: I’m Microsoft Regional Director, Windows Platform MVP, Pluralsight trainer and Telerik MVP. I live in Tienen, Belgium (not too far from the capital of Europe!). I focus on mobile development for the Windows stack as well as Xamarin. I love giving talks, giving trainings and talking tech. I’m a frequent speaker at many international conferences such as TechDays, TechEd, NDC, VSLive and many more. I’m also the founder of Techorama, the biggest developer conference in Belgium. Oh and I run Visug, the .NET user group.

5.name: Benjamin Xzan Monjoie
5.title: Android Developer
5.shortBio: Founder & Organizer of the GDG Namur Android
5.bio: Developer since 2004, I have grown fond of Android since I started tinkering with it in 2011. I was previously employed at Emakina as lead Android developer. Since July 2016, I started my carrer as a freelancer. Through my work, I do my best to share my passion for the platform and ensure Android applications are not copy/pasted from their iOS counter-part. I stay closely up-to-date with Google's guidelines and innovations to advise and take decisions that would fit best in an Android application.

6.name: Yannick Lemin
6.title: Freelancer, Android Architect
6.bio:
I am a freelancer in Android development / architecture.

I am very passionate about new technologies. I have grown a very big interest for mobile development, and more particularly native Android, which I have been playing with for over 5 years.

I also keep up with the latest in web development technologies, front and back-end, such as JavaScript frameworks (AngularJS, Dart, ...), industrialization solutions (Grunt, bower, Sass, ...).

I am also very interested in the “Internet of Things” as well as “Quantified Self”.

With over 13 years of Object Oriented programming experience, I push excellence, code quality and robustness, and professionalism in every project I am involved in.

7.name: Martin Görner
7.title: Developer Relations
7.shortBio: Parallel processing and machine learning, as well as all the cool things you can do with them.
7.bio: Parallel processing and machine learning, as well as all the cool things you can do with them.

8.name: Nacho Coloma
8.title: Solutions Engineer for Cloud Platform
8.shortBio: I do things combining web, cloud and chewing gum. Co-organizer @codemotion_es
8.bio: I do things combining web, cloud and chewing gum. Co-organizer @codemotion_es

9.name: Simon Vergauwen
9.title: Android Developer
9.shortBio: I fell in love with Mobile Software development shortly after graduating
9.bio: I'm an Engineer in Electronics-ICT, and I fell in love with Mobile Software development shortly after graduating. I've done multiple project for Telenet and the government. I love to experiment with different frameworks, languages, architecture and design patterns whenever I have time to do so.

10.name: Niels Leenheer
10.title: Developer
10.bio: Niels is a self-professed browser geek. He has been hooked on browsers ever since somebody showed him the original Nexus browser on a NeXT Cube back in the dark ages of the internet. Niels is the creator of HTML5test.com and runs one of the largest Open Device Labs in the world. He loves procrastinating, collecting weird devices with even stranger browsers, procrastinating, researching obscure browsers and writing bug reports.

11.name: Charlotte Labie
11.title: Sales and Marketing Manager
11.shortBio: In my opinion, the best is yet to come!
11.bio: I’m Charlotte, an enthusiastic sales and marketing manager at Fourcast. I’m very interested in technology, especially in what the future will bring us. In my opinion, the best is yet to come!

12.name: Serge Hendrickx
12.title: Developer
12.shortBio: Constantly trying to keep up with every new awesome Google product!
12.bio: Google Cloud Platform and Chrome developer with a passion for everything Google! Started working with the Google Cloud Platform when it was barely released back in 2011. Now working as a developer for Google For Work partner fourcast. Constantly trying to keep up with every new awesome Google product!
